ProductTitle: Nature's Perfect Night | Melatonin 20mg | 180 Quick Dissolve Tablets | Natural Mixed Berry Flavor |High Potency | Sugar Free | Vegan | Gluten Free | Value Size
ReviewContent: People take melatonin for health reasons (vs just sleep)--especially when it involves dosages greater than 5-10 mg.So we don't want other things in it that are there to make it "taste better", like artificial sweeteners.And artificial sweeteners *do* raise blood sugar.I personally know people who have tested this with continuous blood glucose meters that they wear.  Even a stevia soda (e.g. Zevia) can raise blood sugar by 20 points.In any case, sucralose is basically chlorinated sugar in order to render it unrecognizable as a sugar to the body.  Does this sound like a healthy thing to you?So I'm going to consume this product (because I'm cheap and probably one bottle won't do lasting damage) and then I'm going to find a brand that doesn't pollute their own product and use that for the long term.One more thing: at 20 mg dosages or more, people are probably doing "high-dose melatonin" (HDM) for therapies like preventing cancer or the like.We typically don't CARE about taste. We are going for a specific result and just need certain dosages.So I recommend eliminating the need to make them chewable or tasty. The "juice isn't worth the squeeze."Further, sucralose has a nasty aftertaste. So if you are determined to sweeten your product, its a bad choice.Better to use monkfruit or something like that if your'e going to sweeten something up and make someone increase their sugars.At least that's a naturally occurring product whereas sucralose is engineered in a lab.

ProductTitle: Nature's Perfect Night | Melatonin 20mg | 180 Quick Dissolve Tablets | Natural Mixed Berry Flavor |High Potency | Sugar Free | Vegan | Gluten Free | Value Size

ReviewContent: Because of the severe and negative country and world events, I wanted to try Melatonin to sleep better.I am 80, f, in good mental health, I eat only super foods to stay healthy and keep my blood pressure at a good reading.Taking 20mg Melatonin gave me an agitated feeling, dry mouth and caused me to get drowsy when getting up, but NO SLEEP.

ProductTitle: Nature's Perfect Night | Melatonin 20mg | 180 Quick Dissolve Tablets | Natural Mixed Berry Flavor |High Potency | Sugar Free | Vegan | Gluten Free | Value Size
ReviewContent: I am a frequent user of melatonin. I usually purchase higher mg gummies and based on the product,  I am out like a light throughout the night, sleeping peacefully with no side effects like feeling grogginess. I decided to give these a shot, since I like quick dissolve tablets. Plus the the price and mg were right, and they have positive reviews. I've taken them for about a week now, but I am still undecided about the effectiveness.First, I don't care for the taste. I thought they would be more berry flavored, but the flavored seems more bitter and off putting than I would like. They dissolve okay, but take longer to dissolve than I expected. The size and option to break pills is a plus.These do put me to sleep within 15-20 minutes of taking them; however,  I noticed that I don't stay sleep throughout the night. I usually wake up around 4 am. I thought it was because I was only taking 1 pill per the instructions, so I started taking 2, but still not sleeping throughout the night. Maybe my body needs to get use to these, not sure but boy waking up earlier than I want annoying - especially when I am used to sleeping up to 7 hours straight using other products. I don't feel groggy when waking, but I am definitely tired sometimes because my body isn't getting my typical hours of sleep.Hopefully the longer I take these, the better they will work to keep me asleep, but we will see. They are worth a try.

ReviewContent: I’m talking these pill they are 20 mg and still don’t help me sleep

ProductTitle: Nature's Perfect Night | Melatonin 20mg | 180 Quick Dissolve Tablets | Natural Mixed Berry Flavor |High Potency | Sugar Free | Vegan | Gluten Free | Value Size
ReviewContent: People take melatonin for health reasons (vs just sleep)--especially when it involves dosages greater than 5-10 mg.So we don't want other things in it that are there to make it "taste better", like artificial sweeteners.And artificial sweeteners *do* raise blood sugar.I personally know people who have tested this with continuous blood glucose meters that they wear.  Even a stevia soda (e.g. Zevia) can raise blood sugar by 20 points.In any case, sucralose is basically chlorinated sugar in order to render it unrecognizable as a sugar to the body.  Does this sound like a healthy thing to you?So I'm going to consume this product (because I'm cheap and probably one bottle won't do lasting damage) and then I'm going to find a brand that doesn't pollute their own product and use that for the long term.One more thing: at 20 mg dosages or more, people are probably doing "high-dose melatonin" (HDM) for therapies like preventing cancer or the like.We typically don't CARE about taste. We are going for a specific result and just need certain dosages.So I recommend eliminating the need to make them chewable or tasty. The "juice isn't worth the squeeze."Further, sucralose has a nasty aftertaste. So if you are determined to sweeten your product, its a bad choice.Better to use monkfruit or something like that if your'e going to sweeten something up and make someone increase their sugars.At least that's a naturally occurring product whereas sucralose is engineered in a lab.
